data.title: Breakfast and then some
data.text: A little pricey  but worth every penny! You know it's gonna be a good day when there's a rainbow over the Original Pancake House. Better bring your appetite. Everything is huge.

data.title: Go!!! Go here!!! Go here and eat!!!
data.text:
my title says it all.  They have a very extensive menu and selections to eat here.  I had the Eggs Michael (which included an english muffin, sausage links, poached egg, with a mushroom sherry sauce poured over top of it and potato pancakes w/sour cream and applesauce), it was absolutely superb!!!  

If this says anything, we went there on a friday morning at around 10am and there was a line to eat at this restaurant from the time we got there and still even a longer line after we left about 2 hours later.

Food, service, and quality was totally to write home about.  and of course, their pancakes were outta this world.

data.title: Great
data.text: The pancakes and the orange juice are my absolute favorite. It's nice little place and friendly faces

data.title: Oh my gosh - pancakes are delicious
data.text:
Brunches, bloody Mary's, and mimosas are the "in" thing.   But there is something to be said for some throw back, down home, good breakfast food.   The original Pancake House is one of these classics.  

I love the pancake stacks and coffee.   My only issue is that I typically overate when I go here and am a little slow moving for a few hours.  

They are often busy, and have a line to the door.  But don't fret, it goes fast and usually lasts 10-15 minutes.

data.title: Mouth watering!!
data.text:
One of my favorites breakfast place! That Apple Dutch baby what it's called is so... good!
Instead of pancakes I get this with a 2 scrambled eggs with a side of bacon. I will save half for later it's that Big!  The pancakes are old fashion way to fix them, the batter is lite an fluffy. My husband an I go at less one two times a month. The meals are  filling to hold you half a day! Enjoy, staff are very helpful, an hold your patience the lines a long on weekend.

data.title: Great Pancakes
data.text: I was looking for a good place to eat that wouldn't put a hole in my pocket and found this little gem. I still talk about this place a month later.

data.title: The original and still the best!
data.text:
Never outdone by other breakfasts And brunch places in this price range. 

The selection of breakfast dishes is great- way too many to list. Can't go wrong with anything on the menu. 

Just be ready to wait in line, but it's worth it.

data.title: Love It
data.text: My favorite breakfast place. Stays pretty busy but always worth the wait. Staff is nice, food is the best. Will leave full and satisfied.

data.title: Great service - no wonder there was a line!
data.text: Our waitress personified her name - Joy. The food was well prepared and tasty, but it was the service that made the visit so wonderful. If we're ever back in Southfield, we will be back.

data.title: Best Pancakes Ever
data.text: The food here is amazing! The pancakes themselves are very tasty. This restaurant has a really delicious breakfast menu & I've never had a bad experience with service or food.

data.title: Big Apple YES!!
data.text: The big Apple with cinnamon ice cream is so good it's indescribable! Love the food here and try to get here when I visit in town. Love that they open early.

data.title: Always a Delight
data.text: Ohop has the best pancakes in Southeast Michigan! Their bacon is always on point as well. If you would like to share a meal here I recommend the big apple or one of their spectacular made to order omelettes. They give new meaning to the word breakfast and the experience cannot be matched anywhere!  It is a little on the pricey side however you get what you pay for and there is no way you will leave hungry! I always stop there when I'm in Southfield.

data.title: Breakfast is delicious!
data.text: I have eaten at this restaurant (for breakfast only) a total of 3 times and every time the food is delicious and filling.  You do have to wait in line to get a table because they get crowded so fast, so get there when they first open if you don't want to stand in line.  The wait in line will be about 15-20 minutes, depending on how crowded they are.

data.title: Good food
data.text: This is the only place i get pancakes. They are called the original pancake for a reason. The bacon is thick cut and so yummy.

data.title: Excellent!!!
data.text: Great food, great service. I have no complaints and would certainly eat there again! They are quite busy, so I'm guessing service could be slow at times but that was not our experience at all.

data.title: Large portion size
data.text: We tried this place which was close to our hotel. It was packed but we were seated quickly. The food was good and some was huge (we ordered one omelet for all three of us since it was very big). Overall good quality food for the price

data.title: Not of the IHOP chain brand
data.text: This place is amazing, just need to get in early. Sunday morning is always busy, but worth the wait, service, food, price. Never a bad meal.

data.title: It was OK!
data.text: Before visiting a read numerous reviews about how great the food is.  We arrived waiting for a table for 8 to be seated.  The wait was one hour because the restaurant was crowded.  We ordered the famous orange juice, but because they freshly squeeze the juice it tasted like pulp and water with a hint of orange.  The food is a bit pricey and they dont really give you a lot.  If you visit any Coney Island in the city of Detroit for breakfast they are loading your plate down with food but not here.  I did see the omelette that a friend ordered and it was a very nice size.  So if omelettes are your thing then that would be a good choice.  Our food was good.  The pancakes, bacon, and potatoes were great.  It just did not meet my expectations but it was OK. The customer service was great and they had a great atmosphere.

data.title: Seasonal Specialty Satisfies!
data.text: During the hectic holiday shopping routine, my wife and I chose to grab some brunch at the Original Pancake House, and were so delighted with the decision.  Despite the typical crowds, we were seated quickly and received excellent service.  Let your imagination flow and the menu will justify your fantasy.  Even though I had traditional eggs, toast, bacon and sausage, the impulse to order more was not to be denied, so I asked for pumpkin pancakes.  That was a glimpse of heaven!  Thanks for that and more.

data.title: Great food
data.text: I really enjoyed the food. I went there a few time since I was working in the area for the week. Love the big apple!
